required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Maternal Serum Homocysteine Levels and Uterine Artery Pulsatility Indices in Preterm Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Maternal Serum Homocysteine Levels and Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index as Predictors of Spontaneous Preterm Labor

brief_summary.textblock: Study included all pregnant women admitted with threatened preterm labor during the study period. All participants underwent estimation of maternal serum homocysteine level and assessment of uterine artery Doppler indices.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective cohort study. Study approval by local ethics committee. Informed written consent. Study included all pregnant women admitted with threatened preterm labor during the study period. All participants underwent estimation of maternal serum homocysteine level and assessment of uterine artery Doppler indices.

primary_outcome.measure: The accuracy of serum homocysteine levels and uterine artery pulsatility indices (UtA-PI ) for prediction of preterm labor
primary_outcome.time_frame: Single measurement at the end of the study ( around 37 gestational weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity (%), specificity (%), positive predictive value (%), negative predictive value (%), positive likelihood ratio (number), negative likelihood ratio (number), accuracy (%) of serum homocysteine and UtA-PI for prediction of preterm labor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single measurement at the end of the study ( around 37 gestational weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Demographic and clinical characteristics of the study groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single measurement on the day one of hospital admission between 28-35 gestational weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal age (year), Body mass index (kilogram per squared meter), Gestational age at admission (Weeks), Maternal serum Homocysteine level ( micromoles/liter), uterine artery pulsatility index ( number)

arm_group.description: included pregnant females delivered prior to completed 37 weeks of gestation. All participants underwent assessment of uterine artery Doppler indices and maternal serum homocysteine estimation
Included pregnant females delivered after completed 37 weeks of gestation. All participants underwent assessment of uterine artery Doppler indices and maternal serum homocysteine estimation

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant with singleton pregnancy, more than 28 and less than 35 gestational weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy
- More than 28 and less than 35 gestational weeks.
- Threatened preterm labor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical disorders complicating pregnancy
- Obstetric conditions complicating pregnancy (e.g., placenta previa, multiple gestation,PPROM, ....etc)
- Fetal anomalies or distress
